1.Summary: "Yes, the employment experience is as bad as the service"
1.Pros: -Easy to get hired. Like REALLY easy.-You can meet some cool people and network really well
1.Cons: -High turn-over rate-no chance for career advancement-Doesn't care about customer service-Will hire ANYONE so you won't know if your coworker or supervisor is a convict-Manager will tell you not to eat fries out of the pit, but will proceed to eat fries out of the pit-You find out how unsanitary McDonald's really is

3.Pros: Flexible, food at all times if you know the right ways to sneak it.
3.Cons: Sometimes I wanted to kill myself when working

4.Pros: I worked at two different restaurants in Maine, one located in a small city and the other located in a very rural small town.--very flexible schedule, you can decide and change your availability and they will respect it--it is very fast-paced and lots of multitasking (if you work during the day, the night shift is very slooow)
4.Cons: --your experience will completely depend on the management and who works with you, if you have mean scary managers and rude coworkers, then it is going to be a rough experience but if you are lucky enough to have cool people to work with, it'll be great--it is tiring standing on your feet all day long--some customers really treat you horribly

5.Pros: Good first job for young person
5.Cons: Not the best place to be long term

6.Pros: Flexible schedule and they pay your meals
6.Cons: Too busy and most of the time you ended don't over time

7.Cons: To many rude costumers witch sucks because it's hard to get a good review.
